If you want to use word database of protected areas (WDPA) data or a combination of WDPA data with custom data, use the "ProtConn analysis with WDPA" pipeline.

pipeline@9.label: Coordinate reference system
pipeline@9.description:
This input specifies the coordinate reference system of the country polygon output.

The numerical value refers to the EPSG code (European Petroleum Survey Group) associated with the spatial reference system that will be used as a reference for the study area.
This numerical value specifies the projection and geodetic datum used to define the coordinates and spatial representation of the data in the study area.

For further information on coordinate systems and EPSG codes, you can access the official database on the EPSG website at [https://epsg.org/home.html](https://epsg.org/home.html).
The website provides documentation, resources, and tools for searching and understanding the EPSG codes used in various geospatial contexts.

This threshold represent the median dispersal probability (i.e. where the dispersal probabilty between patches is 0.5). metadata.name: ProtConn Analysis with custom PAs
metadata.description:
This pipeline calculates ProtConn (Protected Connected Index) with user-input data. This pipeline accepts a geopackage file of protected areas within a study area.  To run with World Database of Protected Areas (WDPA) data or combine WDPA with user data,
 see the "ProtConn analysis with WDPA" pipeline. 
 
The pipeline uses the MK_Protconn function in the Makurhini package to calculate the percentage of the study area that is protected and connected, based on median dispersal distances and the distance between protected areas.
